intro: Hibbertia oligodonta, commonly known as the narrow-leaved hibbertia, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Dilleniaceae and is characterized by its woody stems and showy, yellow-orange flowers. The plant typically grows in heathlands and open forests, preferring well-drained soils. Its leaves are narrow and often have a hairy texture, while the flowers are borne in clusters at the ends of branches. Hibbertia oligodonta is adapted to dry conditions and is often found in regions with a Mediterranean climate.
